title: Proverbs and Wisdom
description: Learn traditional Portuguese proverbs and sayings

questions.prompt: What does 'Água mole em pedra dura, tanto bate até que fura' mean?
questions.explanation: Like 'constant dripping wears the stone' - persistence and patience achieve results.

questions.prompt: Complete: 'Quem não tem cão, caça com ___'
correct_answers: Quem não tem cão, caça com gato
questions.hint: Meaning: make do with what you have

pairs: Grão a grão enche a galinha o papo
Mais vale tarde do que nunca
De pequenino se torce o pepino
Em terra de cegos, quem tem um olho é rei
In the land of the blind...

questions.prompt: What does 'Quem com ferros mata, com ferros morre' correspond to?
questions.explanation: Similar to 'live by the sword, die by the sword' - actions have consequences.

questions.prompt: Build: 'A friend in need is a friend indeed'
What proverb means 'The squeaky wheel gets the grease'?
What does 'Cão que ladra não morde' mean?
options: Barking dogs seldom bite / All talk, no action
questions.explanation: Those who make the most threats are often least likely to act.

pairs: A cavalo dado não se olha o dente
Don't look a gift horse in the mouth

content.text: Proverbs are widely used in Portuguese conversation. Using them appropriately shows cultural fluency.
Some proverbs may sound old-fashioned. Listen to how native speakers use them in context.
